itineraries.title: CHRIS'S JOURNEY - ON THE TRAIL OF THE ART OF LIVING

visits.text: Belgrade: lively cafés, first Balkan encounters and preparation for the great departure.

activities.text: Strolling along the banks of the Danube and Sava, observing the city and adjusting the itinerary.

visits.text: Pristina: crossing a capital still marked by recent history, first rural villages.
Skopje: passage through a crossroads city, mixture of modernity and more modest neighborhoods.
Prilep: small towns and countryside, improvisations to survive and first mechanical troubles.

activities.text: Getting help for makeshift repairs and discovering the solidarity of the inhabitants.

visits.text: Thessaloniki: port stop, discovery of the Mediterranean and bustling markets.
Alexandroupoli: coastal city facing the Aegean Sea, mixture of cultures on the waterfront.

activities.text: Observing the port activity and the comings and goings of ferries and cargo ships.

visits.text: Edirne: gateway to Turkey, mosques and bazaars mark the entrance to the Orient.
Istanbul: crossing the Bosphorus, immersion in the souks, hammams and alleys of the old city.

activities.text: Going from one continent to another by ferry and feeling complete disorientation.

visits.text: Sungurlu: first kilometers in the heart of interior Anatolia.
Trabzon: arrival on the Black Sea, stopover in a port city between mountains and sea.
Erzurum: ascent toward the high plateaus, first great steppe expanses.

activities.text: Being welcomed in Anatolian villages and sharing tea and simple meals.

visits.text: Kop Pass: sublime and challenging mountain road, oscillating between fog, snow and clear sky.

activities.text: Stopping at the roadside to contemplate the undulations of the earth and the immensity of the landscapes.

visits.text: Tabriz: long winter halt, forced pauses due to climate and travel fatigue.

activities.text: Learning to live at the rhythm of the city, frequenting bazaars and tea houses despite the isolation.

visits.text: Mahabad: forced stay with the police for lack of means, meticulous observation of bazaar life.

activities.text: Observing minorities and market exchanges, despite the uncomfortable position of a destitute traveler.

visits.text: Tehran: immersion in a capital that is both modern and traditional.

activities.text: Navigating between offices for visas and evenings spent discussing with the inhabitants.

visits.text: Isfahan: wonder at the squares, bridges and mosques of the former capital.
Persepolis: direct confrontation with the ruins of the Achaemenid empire.
Yazd: desert cities, ancient quarters and wind towers.
Bam: citadel and oasis landscapes, travel journal in hand.

activities.text: Encounters with scholars, artists and hosts of traditional houses.

visits.text: Zahedan: large city in eastern Iran, last major center before the desert.
Mirjaveh: border post and gates to the desert, preparations for the passage to the subcontinent.

activities.text: Feeling fatigue and fascination for the infinite spaces of Baluchistan.

visits.text: Quetta: major stopover in Pakistan, simple life and exchanges with other travelers.

activities.text: Adapting to local constraints and sharing stories and plans over modest meals.

visits.text: Kandahar: route through the plains and landscapes of southern Afghanistan.
Kabul: arrival in the capital nestled between mountains, moments of doubt and personal accomplishment.

activities.text: Participating in excavations and exploring the archaeological traces of the country.

visits.text: Khyber Pass: end of the narrated journey, impression of having crossed an entire world.

activities.text: Recapping the path traveled and the encounters, at the threshold of India.

seo.h1_title: Silk Road Odyssey: Belgrade to Kabul Overland Adventure
seo.intro_paragraph: Cross Belgrade and its fortresses, then reach Istanbul at the crossroads of worlds. Pass through Tabriz and its bazaar, then cross Iranian passes before reaching Quetta and its harsher lands. End in Kabul at the foot of the Hindu Kush. An intense itinerary, made of ancient roads, crossroad cities and raw horizons.
seo.seo_hook: Fortresses guarding confluences, bazaar labyrinths echoing centuries of trade, passes crossing watersheds. The ancient Silk Road.
